N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 168.5 - Nontraditional modes of instruction

State Regulations
(a) For aid payable pursuant to the
provisions of subdivision 24 of section
3602
of the

Education Law for employment preparation education programs employing
nontraditional modes of instruction approved in accordance with the
requirements set forth in section
168.3
(b) and (c)
of this Part, the number of hours of instruction shall be calculated by
multiplying the number of teacher hours for such programs by 12. Such hours of
instruction shall be eligible for State aid provided that no more than one-half
teacher hour per enrollee per week is claimed for aid purposes. (b) Each participating district or BOCES
shall maintain appropriate records of enrollment and teacher hours, and shall
file such reports as may be required by the commissioner. (c) The provisions of this section shall be
effective for programs operated during the 1984-85 school year and
thereafter. Notes
